Email DT 18/05 River Cynon Underbridge 1 timber deck severely degraded in multiple locations. No work to be undertaken on bridge deck unless agreed with Buildings & Civils Engineer. Protected Plant Species - Radyr Hawkweed <Hieracium radyrense> recorded.No re-pointing or retaining wall works are carried out in this area and strictly no herbicide use without Environmental consultation first. Obtain specialist environmental advise before undertaking any other types of works in this area - Radyr Hawkweed is a rare endemic plant that has been recorded from only one locaion nationally and as such appears on section 42 of the NERC Act 20061 and is identified as "critically endangered" by the IUCN.

- Lineside & On or near the line <Cess only>: except for existing control measure work activities relating to the earthwork, all other renewal and maintenance work activities in this area are to remain suspended.~
- On or near the line <excluding Cess>: track, signalling, telecoms & electrical essential light maintenance and patrolling activities permitted only.~
Downside:~
- Lineside & On or near the line <Cess only>: light maintenance & renewal activities permitted.  Any temporary linear excavations to be limited to 0.2m depth and 5m "hit and miss" bay lengths, and work activity induced vibrations to be no greater than caused by normal railway operations~
- On or near the line <excluding Cess>: track, signalling, telecoms & electrical essential light maintenance and patrolling activities permitted only.~
~
Any other proposed work that falls outside these restrictions requires agreement by the AIW Building & Civils Engineer by no later than T-4 weeks prior to start of works.

FOLLOWING CORE RENEWAL WORKS AT CARDIFF QUEEN STREET ON THE CAM LINES WE HAVE INSTALLED A NEW LOOP LINE INTO THE NEW PLATFORM 5 AT CQS, THIS WORKS IS PART OF THE CASR IP WORKS.  WE HAVE INSTALLED 2 S&C UNITS INTO/OUT OF THE NEW UP LLANDAFF LOOP.  THE NEW PLATFORM 5 IN CQS SITS BETWEEN THE FOLLOWING LOCATIONS: 1M 49Y - 1M 254Y.  COULD YOU PLEASE UPDATE THE DIRECTORY WITH THESE DETAILS AND ALSO HIGHLIGHT THAT THE STATION AREA WILL BECOME "WARNING SSOW BANNED" ONCE PLATFORM 5 GOES INTO OPERATION.

WE HAVE INSTALLED NEW TURNOUT 9425PTS INTO THE NEW BAY LINE FROM 8M 194Y - 8M 484Y.  COULD YOU PLEASE UPDATE THE DIRECTORY WITH THESE DETAILS AND ALSO HIGHLIGHT THE NEW BAY LINE WILL BECOME WARNING SSOW BANNED WITHIN THE PLATFORM LIMITS. With the introduction of the second track between Merthyr Vale and Troed-Y-Rhiw the bridge at Merthyr vale is now a limited clearance area. Signs fixed to the bridge wall: the limited clearance is for a 5m stretch of wall
Upgrade existing access point to a RRV access point with a hols fat crossing in place

With a track slew that has taken place the running line is now too close to an existing doglegged palisade fence which will cause a 5m limited clearance issue. Signs will be be in place at the start and the finish.

FOLLOWING CORE RENEWAL WORKS AT TIR PHIL ON THE CAR LINE, WE HAVE INSTALLED A NEW 856M LONG DOWN LOOP PASSING LINE AS PART OF THE  CASR IP WORKS.  WE HAVE INSTALLED 2 S&C UNITS ALSO THUS ALLOWING AN ENTRANCE AND EXIT POINT FROM THE EXISTING SINGLE LINE.  LASTLY, THERE HAS ALSO BEN A NEW PLATFORM ERECTED AT TIR PHIL STATION ADJACENT TO THE EXISTING PLATFORM BETWEEN 20M 0793 YARDS TO 20M 0935 YARDS.  ENTRY MADE AS NEW ADDITIONS TO THIS AREA HAS MADE SOME OF THE WARNING SSOW BANNED I.E. STATION LIMIT AREA.  GRID REF: SO140031

NO PLACE OF SAFETY. WARNING SSOW PROHIBITED WALK+ WORK - LIMITED CLEARANCE. LIMITED CLEARANCE INTRODUCED WITH INTRODUCTION OF NEW LOOP.  THERE IS NO POSITIO NOF SAFETY FROM STATION WHEN TRACK PASSES UNDER ROADBRIDGE UNTIL THE NEW POINTS JUST PAST ABBEY VALLEY.  FENCE ON UP SIDE <RAILWAY TERRACE GARDENS> BANK THEN STEEP DROP ON DOWN SIDE.  SUBMISSION FROM: KEITH MOREY, NETWORK RAIL CRINDAU WORKS, NEWPORT

A new asset in the form of ballast retention <Bafix> has been installed in the six-foot as part of Treforest LSI track design <Drawing No. TRAN01-KAW-R0-R2P-DDR-R-TR-000016_C02> between Ch 113980m to Ch 114140m <09Miles 1393yards - 09Miles 1568yards>.
 
The six-foot ballast retention has a potential to be a slips, trips & falls hazard, and machinery <such as ballast cleaners, brushers, etc.> are also prohibited from operating within the extents where ballast retention <Bafix> has been installed in the six-foot, unless machinery has been specially designed or adapted to work in that environment.

Tonteg feeder station is hot site. A HOT site is defined as one which exceeds telecoms limits for Earth Potential Rise <EPR>. Typically, these thresholds are 650 V <for reliable fault clearance time <= 0.2 seconds>, or 430 V otherwise.
 
Care should be taken to ensure that telecommunications and other systems are not adversely impacted by substation or structure EPR; in general, these systems should be routed so that they are not adversely affected by passing through an area of high earth potential rise <HPR>. Where the EPR on substations or structures exceeds certain levels, the operators of these systems should be notified.
